tweets.text:
Going #Fishing? Remember, it‚Äôs close season for coarse fishing on rivers. This means it's illegal to fish for course fish in rivers until 15th June inclusive.

If you spot incidents of illegal fishing, you can report this to the Environment Agency‚Äôs incident number 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/Pmp3PCZ7qb
#stopthestink Worlds gone mad @NewsNBC @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK https://t.co/8zBAQJbZ8A

Floating pennywort is an invasive plant that costs the economy at least ¬£25 million a year.

To tackle this, we have teamed up with @AnglingTrust, @BritishCanoeing and an army of local volunteers, to leave floating pennywort with nowhere to hide. 

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/NCESUYazJc https://t.co/YpvN7pBbbo

Hi @EnvAgency cc @SouthamptonCC I saw this on #Southampton Common. Well meaning but discriminatory IMHO. We have many citizens with different 1st languages. This stigmatises #Polish  Clear simple English with good graphics is enough. https://t.co/Ti5CRR7lFJ

New estate local to us #Margate ‚¨áÔ∏è Built on scrubland, biodiversity mitigation appears to be a few dead trees. And a lot of concrete @NaturalEngland @CPRE @CPREKent @EnvAgency https://t.co/ULaRSRMqi8

Currently growing barley but it‚Äôs future = concrete. And a massive SuDS area to mitigate against flooding. Because this is a river valley. It handily holds excess water for us for free. Utter madness to build here!! @CPREKent @CommunityPlann1 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/owzHqgEN8G
@DrMickSalt @SarahInNUL @EnvAgencyMids Above WHO levels 0.01% of time at Blaydon, didnt Gallingale suffer 48% of time very recently!

tweets.text: @ldmartens1 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids Inescapable Lydia. Hope you manage to go further afield at the weekends and get some fresh air! Glad I don‚Äôt work from home, the fumes do reach my workplace but nowhere near as bad as at home! #stopthestink
@ollyandpatch @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids #StopTheStink

It‚Äôs #INNSweek! Floating Pennywort is a non-native species which spreads throughout a watercourse rapidly and causes issues with navigation and water quality. We‚Äôve been out in #Leicester to monitor its spread and target effective treatment on the River Soar @InvasiveSp https://t.co/bzzQJxx68K

What a beautiful day in #Cumbria today üå§Ô∏è 

Our field teams are mowing the flood defences by the river Kent downstream from #Kendal to keep the banks in tip top condition. 

The banks are walked beforehand to check for any nesting birds üê¶ https://t.co/OSnbAhkPSV

@JuliaBradbury @davemh72 @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK It‚Äôs starting to feel like a cover up Julia, high levels of methane as well and particulate matter which can be very hazardous to health.They think we will pipe down but we won‚Äôt. Our children‚Äôs health & futures are at stake #stopthestink
